reviews.review_msg: One of the best profs I've ever had at SFU! She is passionate about her subject and genuinely interested in what you have to say. She gives clear, well-organized and interesting lectures and reasonable amounts of reading. I'd recommend her any day!

The class was okay and her marking was fair, maybe a bit hard but she's approachable and very willing to help or suggest supplementary materials or films.  There are a lot of little details so make sure you pay attention.
Extremely interesting class, you will take lots and lots of notes.  Less assignments than other upper division history classes and she is a really easy marker.

Best prof, very interesting to listen to, even if you do not have a high intrest in her topics, told an interesting story of German history and compelled students to be interested, hard marker but if you work hard she will reward you and she gives very helpful advice on papers. I would take a class with her in a second
Made the class very interesting with very compeling

This prof is the most beautiful historian I have ever met. That alone made the class worth while. But more than that, she made class interesting, and was very clear and concise. If you have an opportunity, definatly take this professor
Very engaging speaker, extremely interested in what she is talking about.  Topic super interesting too.  This class is highly recommended

She comes off like a bit of a hippy at first, but don't be fooled, she is very intelligent and knowledgeable about history. Her lectures were great because she was so passionate. Passionate is really the best word, she speaks with this intensity and interest that really brings the subject to life. I don't think she's really THAT hard.
Dr. Roth is an amazing teacher! Very passionate abut her subject, a great tutorial leader, and very organized lectures: the whole package. Plus, she is kinda hot in a sexy librarian way.
Best all round teacher at the school.  Not easy but fair and she's hot.
Great teacher, very knowledgable about Germany and a sweetheart. Not the easiest teacher but one of the BEST! Take her class if you can, you won't regret it.

Easy marker, even if he talks tough at the beginning of the course and says he has high standards.  Like others have said, very entertaining and knowledgeable.  It's easy to get into the A range with him as long as you're willing to do a bit of work.  Gives a lot of feedback and suggestions if you ask for it.

Ridiculous amount of weekly readings which you will not even be assessed on, since the course has limited opportunity for participation, and you are never actually assessed on the information in the readings (outside of primary sources, which are a fraction of the actual readings). Not remotely fair or just in terms of grading.

Lectures can be a little dry, but always focused and informative. Very knowledgeable on modern German history, especially in her stark, but sobering, insight into the mechanisms and consequences of the most infamous genocidal regime in history. Readings are well-selected and diverse in content. Highly recommended if pursuing a history major.
